meanings.definition: A small, round fruit with a red or purple skin.
meanings.sent1: I picked a ripe birrotch from the tree.
meanings.sent2: The birrotch looked delicious in the fruit bowl.
meanings.sent3: The birrotch rolled off the table and caused a mess.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks were as red as a ripe birrotch.
meanings.sent5: The birrotch burst with flavor in my mouth.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, harsh noise.
meanings.sent1: The thunderstorm outside birrotched all night.
meanings.sent2: The old door birrotched when it opened.
meanings.sent3: The cat birrotched loudly when it saw a mouse.
meanings.sent4: The engine birrotched like an angry beast.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks birrotched in the sky with bright colors.

meanings.definition: A feeling of annoyance or frustration.
meanings.sent1: Her constant complaints were a birrotch to everyone.
meanings.sent2: He felt a birrotch when his computer crashed before saving.
meanings.sent3: The long line at the store was a real birrotch.
meanings.sent4: The traffic jam was a birrotch on his way to work.
meanings.sent5: The never-ending paperwork was a birrotch to complete.
